;摘要

;水星球边界 (PB) 量化了人类用水的安全操作空间，并被理解为与选定阈值（或危险水平）基于安全距离设置的控制变量本着预防原则。水PB对指导可持续发展具有重要意义，各种水PB多尺度定量评价已经开展。为了增进我们的理解并指导未来的应用，我们对自该概念引入以来发表的所有研究进行了全面审查。我们在文献中确定了总共 288 篇相关论文，并对 28 篇论文进行了系统回顾和荟萃分析，提供了不同空间尺度的 488 条数据记录。分析主要涉及相关量化指标（QIs）、量化方法、水PB与不同尺度用水现状的比较，以及相关问题的识别。最后，我们提出了未来重要研究的十个展望。这篇综述表明，作为一个早期研究领域的理论水-PB 框架已经逐渐发展，尽管可用的方法很少，而且还不完善。为了解决以往研究的局限性，我们提出了两个改进框架来指导未来的研究：在一致的科学框架内进一步改进传统流行的量化多尺度水 PB 的方法和改进的量化不同尺度水 PB 的框架以获得更适合不同研究目的和研究领域的结果。基于这篇综述，我们指出了一些鲜为人知的重要问题，包括安全距离的量化和多尺度水 PB 之间的联系。

;摘要

;

;许多河流和溪流没有测量或测量不当，预测此类流域的流量具有挑战性。 Although streamflow signals result from processes with different frequencies, they can be “sparse” or have a “lower-dimensional” representation in a transformed feature space. In such cases, if this appropriate feature space can be identified from streamflow data in gauged watersheds by dimensionality reduction, streamflow in poorly gauged watersheds can be predicted with a few measurements taken. This study utilized this framework, named data-driven sparse sensing (DSS), to predict daily-scale streamflow in 543 watersheds across the contiguous United States. A tailored library of features was extracted from streamflow training data in watersheds within the same climatic region, and this feature space was used to reconstruct streamflow in poorly gauged watersheds and identify the optimal timings for measurement. Storage-dominated systems are lower-dimensional and more predictable than rainfall-dominated systems. Measurements taken during periods with large streamflow magnitudes and/or variances are more informative and lead to better predictions. This study demonstrates that DSS can be an especially useful technique to integrate ground-based measurements with remotely sensed data for streamflow prediction, sensor placement, and watershed classification.
